storyInfo:
Zima cannot wake up from her nightmare.
She always has such dreams. She will always have such dreams.

attributes.content: It's morning. I come out of my room as usual.
Sonya, are you finished washing up?
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: I'm not a kid anymore, mom.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Mom calls to me from the kitchen, where she's cooking. I sit down at the table to wait for my piping hot breakfast.
Breakfast would normally be a bowl of porridge served with bread and ham. I guess she wants to lose weight, so we only have oatmeal porridge.
Fine by me.
Dad sits reading the papers. Everything in them is always so boring. Political and economic stuff I have no interest in.
Why don't they run stories about my glorious accomplishments?
Sonya, how's school going?
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: This again.
Doesn't he get tired of going through these motions twice a day? It's only ever at breakfast and dinner that he pretends to care.
...Fine.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: You're in seventh grade already. It's time you start behaving.
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: Why? I'm only in seventh grade.
And have you decided what you'll do after you finish ninth?
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: ...Not yet.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: After ninth grade, I have to decide whether I'll keep studying or go to technical school to learn a trade.
I know Dad would rather I go to trade school. And I'm sure he's about to say so.
I think you should...
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: Don't push your hangups onto your daughter. Did you find work yet?
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: Mom interrupts Dad as she carries our breakfast out of the kitchen.
...I have an interview today.
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: Since losing his job, Dad's struggled to look Mom in the eye. Not that it was much better before.
You have to put aside your pride, Pierre. We can't eat dignity.
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: I know. I'm trying, Anna.
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: Mom cares a lot more about my studies than Dad. She wants me to stay in school after graduation. She's even saved up money for it.
She always talks about how you couldn't go all the way through ninth grade for free in her day.
And at the same time, acknowledge how lucky she was to have been a maid to the nobility.
She finished her studies at a girls' school, which let her get a pretty good job, even in a lousy economy like this one.
Sometimes, I wish I could be a good girl for her. Too bad I can't.
If only you were. Come on, Sonya, eat up. You don't want to miss the bus.
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: I look down at my breakfast, baffled by the strange look of it all——A sad little glop of porridge, half a slice of bread, and a suspiciously shaped ham.
Mom... what's this?
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: What do you mean? It's the same thing we eat every day.
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: No it isn't!
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Did you forget?
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: A girl who looks exactly like me appears at the table.
Who are you? Why do you look like me?
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: I am you.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: She's me? That's ridiculous. Then who am I?
You're Sonya.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: This makes no sense.
But even weirder is how Mom and Dad have no reaction to this doppelganger popping up at our table.
Sonya, what are you daydreaming about? Eat your breakfast.
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: Oh, I get it. This is a nightmare. That's the easiest explanation. Hah. It's just some weird-looking food. I've had scarier dreams.
Those were fantasies you pulled from comics and games.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: You used to think unbelievably powerful things were the scariest.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: A column of tanks, a giant monster, your father's fist. Something simple and cruel.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: What is she saying? How could she know?
What's it to you? You're just a figment of my imagination too. How else would you know what I'm thinking?
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Take a closer look at the food you're holding.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: What...?!
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: It's not porridge. It's rice in water with some weeds mixed in. It's nothing like Mom's cooking!
The bread... it's bread, but it smells terrible, like it's been left out for days on end.
...But how should I know that?
The ham looks like it's been torn off a bigger hunk of flesh, and it smells almost... fishy. Wait, is this... blood?!
...*Puke*.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: It's just a nightmare!
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: But you've never had one like this. And it feels so real. It's as if...
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: I get the sense that my doppelganger wants to tease me, but teacher always says teasing is a way of making yourself happy by hurting others.
And she doesn't look happy.
Either way, I know I can't let her get away with it.
Even if the food's a bit worse, does that make a life not worth living?
I have to shut her up and get to school!
Shut up!
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: I know the best way to deal with somebody mouthing off: my fists.
Doesn't it feel just like you've actually eaten it?
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: I clench my fist and lunge at her, but she's one step ahead.
My right hook slams hard into the face of the boy in front of me.
The feeling of bone crushing against skin is comforting, in a way.
Gah!
attributes.name: Student A

attributes.content: S- so strong. I thought for sure a dozen of us would be enough, but she wiped the floor with us...
attributes.name: Student B

attributes.content: Blyat'! Even weak cubs like you want to play bully? It'll take more than that.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: *Spit*, go. Just you wait, General Zima, this isn't over!
attributes.name: Student C

attributes.content: Honestly, I like the name 'General Zima.'
It's badass.
But these punks always come at me while I'm trying to nap. Don't they know I usually skip afternoon class?
Err, thanks, General Zima.
attributes.name: Bullied Student

attributes.content: Huh? You're still here? You didn't run away?
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: I wanted to thank you this time.
attributes.name: Bullied Student

attributes.content: This time?
Oh, you don't recognize me? My name is Valeria. This isn't the first time you've had to save me.
attributes.name: Bullied Student

attributes.content: Now that she mentions it, the yellow bow in this girl's hair does look familiar.
Was it last week? Or last month? I'm pretty sure I helped her, yeah.
You saved my friends too. We're all so thankful to you.
attributes.name: Bullied Student

attributes.content: Looking at her bright, shiny face, some of her happiness infects me. But I still have to keep up appearances.
I just can't stand these shitheads pushing the little people around.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: And you need to work up some courage. If you were braver, they'd be the ones scared of you.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Yes... You're right. I'll try.
attributes.name: Bullied Student

attributes.content: Good. Now get out of here.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Bye. And thanks again!
attributes.name: Bullied Student

attributes.content: She yells back as she runs off.
Hm?
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Is it just me, or is everything in the classroom much dirtier than it was?
Eh, whatever. Back to my nap.
I pull four chairs together and lay down.
What's that?
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: My back is pressing into something.
I reach behind me and pull out a yellow bow.
It looks so familiar. But it's dirty, and one side is broken.
Huh?!
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: The back of the bow is stained a dark black color, like...
Blood.
...It must be ketchup.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: I toss the bow aside and go back to sleep.
But before I can slip into my slumber, I hear a voice.
You found this bow later, in one of the classrooms.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: Admit it, you know she is dead.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: The classroom door suddenly flies open, interrupting my nap.
A girl with glasses walks in, carrying a book. I can tell from her uniform that she doesn't go to this school.
Excuse me, is anyone else here?
This is my territory. I'm the only one allowed in.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Sorry, but my friends and I are looking for shelter...
Um, are you... Sonya?
You're... Anna?
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Anna used to be my neighbor. I haven't seen her in years, since we moved, but...
Take another classroom.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Honestly, she asked nicely, and it's not like we didn't get along before. I don't really want to turn her down.
But things have gotten rough among the kids here since the first fire. I had to fight off three gangs today alone.
I know this might bother you, Sonya, but...
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: There's only one inside, Anna. Let's just chase her away.
attributes.name: Voice Outside the Door

attributes.content: Oh, okay. Time for another fight.
Then we'd be no different from the robbers. That isn't us.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: ...Anna's the same as she ever was. A peacemaker.
Right. Um, I'm Lada, and I'm a pretty good cook. What if I made you something to eat in return for letting us hide here?
I have to say, that's a pretty tempting offer. It's been a while since I've had something that didn't just come out of a can.
Okay. You can stay. But watch your step. I'm Sonya. And you don't mess with me.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Did she just say Sonya...? Is that actually 'General Zima?!'
attributes.name: Voice Outside the Door

attributes.content: She's famous even over at our school. She's easily the strongest girl in the district.
attributes.name: Voice Outside the Door

attributes.content: No way... sounds like we lucked out.
attributes.name: Voice Outside the Door

attributes.content: I have to say, I enjoy the acclaim. But the best part is seeing the face of a good girl like Anna turn upside down when she hears it.
Thank you, Sonya. We'll try not to bother you.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: ...Damn. No reaction. Lame.
After I give my permission, she leads her whole caravan in.
The first bunch are a mix of girls and boys. Their clothes are pretty ragged, their hair all messy, and they clearly haven't slept in days.
Then behind them...
What the hell?!
A bunch of empty, floating school uniforms?!
And at the very back of the crowd is me.
Floating sailor suits, huh? That's quite a coping mechanism.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: What are you talking about?! I mean, who even are you?!
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: I'm you. And you're dreaming, idiot.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: Mmh. Agh.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: That makes sense. Something like this has to be a dream... But why did I just call myself an idiot?!
I mean, at least it's better than a bunch of headless zombies.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: What do you mean? Why would there be headless zombies?
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Because you killed them all.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: Why would I do that?
Because they were going to attack you. Weren't they, Istina?
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: There was no other way. They forced your hand.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: Right. As long as there's a good reason for it, violence is okay. That's how I roll.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: Is that really what you think?
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: I always believed I was doing the right thing.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: This is pretty weird, even for a dream. My doppelganger is having a conversation with a girl I barely know, as if they're old friends. But all reason tells me they're both just figments of my imagination.
That reminds me, shouldn't I have woken up as soon as I realized I was in a dream?
The instant that thought pops into my head, everyone in the room but my doppelganger and the floating uniforms turn to fix their eyes on me.
Every face bears a twisted smile.
They surround me.
You are our leader. You should stay here. You should lead us.
attributes.name: Everyone

attributes.content: I try to find the other me.
But she's gone.
Ugh...
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: My eyes shoot open.
The room around me is still the classroom. It's late at night. The others are asleep. I'm slumped up against the door.
There is another door, but I barricaded it with my desk. The windows have all been sealed. The door next to me is the only way in or out.
I am their leader. I have to protect them.
You can't sleep, Sonya?
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: I hear Anna's voice nearby.
It's been three days since she and her partner joined us. There was some unpleasantness in that time, but Anna sided with me in the end.
Yes. I had a nightmare.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: ...Don't let it get to you. You did nothing wrong.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: I can't remember what I was dreaming about, but Anna must be thinking it was something to do with them.
She feels bad about it. She never imagined the classmates she trusted would go so far as to attack me just because she asked me to lead them.
I killed them all, of course.

I've seen lots of groups fall apart because of little conflicts like this. It's why I didn't want to join a group in the first place. I'd rather communicate with my fists than try to manage relationships.
Don't worry.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: I hear a rustling as she moves over to me.
I know she wants to comfort me, but it's obvious she's the one who needs comforting. I should change the subject.
Anna, were you your class president?
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: So how did you end up with so many followers?
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: I was actually very uncomfortable trying to play leader. But Lada kept pushing me, and I just felt... like I had to do something.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: Aha! You did have to do something!
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: You're teasing me.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: ...But really, when the kids in my class would bully each other, I knew it was wrong. But I just kept to myself. Kept away from it.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: You should've kicked their asses. You're a tough girl.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: It's true. She may look the bookish type, but Anna's really very good in a fight. She just doesn't like to apply herself.
If only I was as brave as you. I can never find the courage to stand up to people.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: Oops, she sounds even sadder than before. I really don't know how to comfort a girl. What can I say to cheer her up?
...At- at least you're standing up now.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: That's the best you could come up with, Sonya?!
...Because I believe it's wrong. At least, that's what I thought at first.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: What's wrong?
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: This. All of it.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: We've been locked up in this school for eight days. Everything keeps getting worse.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: It's all because of that first fire. If it wasn't for the fire...
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: After the fire destroyed one of the food pantries, the noble students from #4 Secondary School occupied the other one. Then they started looting.
You still see commoners fighting over food.
The school looks like a war zone. Debris and graffiti everywhere. And every night is set against the sounds of kids yelling, screaming, crying.
Perhaps, but don't you think that fire was bound to happen sooner or later?
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: Are you saying someone started it on purpose?
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: No. Hrm. How should I put this...? Let me think.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: It's more like that which the fire represents would have come about no matter what.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: I somehow understand even less.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Even without the fire, something would have happened to send us all into a panic... Is that clearer?
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: Weird. It must've been the bad guys who set the fire. The bad guys...
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: There are always bad guys.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: I don't think that's right. But I don't know how to argue with her either.
I once read a book that said human nature is evil.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: I thought it strange at the time. We've built such civilized societies. We live lives of order and morality. How can we be inherently evil?
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: It is with this in mind that I was able to muster the courage to gather everyone up and maintain order.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: But things kept getting worse. And I did nothing about it.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: I didn't restore order. I didn't save anyone. And without you, my classmates might have already killed me...
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: I'm useless.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: Her voice is teetering on the brink of tears.
Aaagh, I made this so much worse!
Whatever. I don't know shit about morals, order, society or any of that. But I understand what she's getting at, so I might as well start talking.
What you're saying is you now think everyone does bad stuff? Including me?
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: ...That's not what I meant.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: Now she sounds surprised. Hah, I got her good with that one.
I fight a lot, but they always deserve it!
Okay, don't be sad. I'll help you.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: ...You will?
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: I'm your leader. And you want to do good. Of course I'll help you.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: ...Thank you, Sonya.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: Hey, isn't it customary for a group to get a new name when it gets a new leader? You got any ideas?
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Let's go with... the 'Ursus Student Self-Governing Group.'
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: ...I probably shouldn't have expected much out of an honor student.
But I guess a straightforward, brass tacks name like that is okay, every once in a while.
All right. From this day forward, we will be known as the 'Ursus Student Self-Governing Group.' I lead the group, and you are my counselor.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: ...Right.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: You heard the relief in her voice, and it made you happy.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: Because you finally protected something. You earned someone's trust. You started feeling like a real leader, like a hero out of one of those novels.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: Who are you?
I'm you. Are you blind?
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: Sure, she does look exactly like me... But why am I raking myself over the coals like this?
And it freaks me out the way she always says what I'm thinking. Not to mention her creepy tone of voice.
It's no fun for me either. But every time I think back on this night, I want to laugh at myself.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: Is that my fault? Or yours?
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: I don't know. And I'm not going to ask you.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: I'm scared you'll say it was your fault. And I'm just as scared you'll say it was mine.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: Suddenly, I realize the floor beneath my feet has become a bottomless void.
And I start to fall.
As I fall, I hear disjointed voices calling out.
Think about it, Anna! Sonya alone can't protect all of us!
The only choice is to join them.
Sonya hates the aristocrats, Vika.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: So you're going to risk all our lives?!
That's when the darkness begins to swallow me.
I drop down from the second story window, landing steadily on the ground.
They'll catch me if I take the main entrance, so this is my only way.
There's something I have to do. Something very important to me.
I understand Anna. Vika's idea makes sense. And I'm not so full of myself I think I can take all those noble shitstains on my own.
At least, I couldn't take them head-on.
They're definitely asleep this late at night. Now's the time to take them all out once and for all.
Well, maybe killing them all is a bit much. Capturing their leader should do the trick. But really, I'll have to cut off the head to let the body die, at least...
Please, let me go!
attributes.name: Student A

attributes.content: Helllp!
attributes.name: Student B

attributes.content: Hand over the food you've been hoarding!
attributes.name: Student C

attributes.content: We... we don't have any food, I swear!
attributes.name: Student A

attributes.content: Please!
attributes.name: Student B

attributes.content: I'm not going to save them.
Not only because I'm busy. I also don't care.
I've seen so much of this these past two days.
I saved a few. And now we've got more kids holed up in the classroom than when Anna showed up with her classmates.
So Anna had to listen to Vika.
But the truth is, even though she told her I don't like nobles, it's actually Anna who hates the aristocrats more than anything.
When those shitheads took the last remaining food store and left the rest of the kids to fight over scraps, that was the last straw for Anna.
She doesn't want to join them.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: And I sure as hell can't change her mind. So it would be nice if the cause of all her worries here just... went away.
I think to myself, as I press on, leaving the screams to fade away behind me.
Hm? That tree was still standing yesterday. Who's bored enough to go around chopping down trees, I...?!
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: I suddenly trip over something, barely keeping myself upright.
I look down to see a fallen road sign, already covered in illegible graffiti.
Hrm.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: It's only been ten days since they locked us in here, but the school looks like it's been abandoned for years.
Pockmarked walls, graffiti, litter, blood...
Honestly, I hate it. And I don't know when it will finally end.
I hang my head and press forward, to the fancy scumbags' base. It's in this warehouse, with the last of our food.
And who do I see standing there? Me.
Who are you?
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: I'm you.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: Not sure why, but I actually wasn't that surprised.
You'll be charging into this warehouse in a minute.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: You wanted to go right for their leader, but you were never very good at sneaking, so you got caught, and you had to face down a phalanx of fancy rich kids.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: You're strong, Sonya. You almost managed to break through them.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: But.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: But you've always been so reckless. You knocked over a lovely candelabra, and, well...
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: Fwooom——
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: My doppelganger suddenly vanishes, and all I can see before me is a pure, fiery red.
I lit the second fire.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: The blaze destroyed the nobles' stronghold, and all the food along with it.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Nothing could be saved. And in Anna's parlance, the fire burned down the final barrier to the students' indiscriminate and chaotic struggle that followed.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: The aristocrats from #4 Secondary School are all gone! Grab what you can!
attributes.name: Student A

attributes.content: I saw those nobles over there! Kill them before they get away!
attributes.name: Student B

attributes.content: Back off! I haven't eaten in three days! I'm looking for food!
attributes.name: Student C

attributes.content: What did you just say?!
attributes.name: Student B

attributes.content: I said get the hell away from me!
attributes.name: Student C

attributes.content: The school descended even further into chaos. Now, nowhere is safe.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Some of our Self-Governing Group have gone missing. Vika never came back.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Piss off!
attributes.name: Student A

attributes.content: It's mine!
attributes.name: Student B

attributes.content: Ah... ugh... help...
attributes.name: Student C

attributes.content: One day, I can't remember which, Reunion suddenly left.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: But they never actually did anything other than lock us inside. And the chaos continued, as if the students didn't even notice they were gone.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: As if they were enjoying the chaos.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Hey, the Reunion guys guarding the school are gone!
attributes.name: Rosalind

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: We can finally leave! Why don't you look excited, Anna?
attributes.name: Rosalind

attributes.content: It doesn't matter anymore.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Ever since the first fire, none of this had anything to do with Reunion.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: But we were not ready to escape the chaos. And the next day, the Catastrophe came.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: The Catastrophe shook everyone.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: It was then that it became clear that they could all leave.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: It was also then that we realized things were even worse outside the school.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Is this... a Catastrophe...?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: What in the world happened...?
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: Aaaaaahhh! I'm scared!
attributes.name: Lada

attributes.content: Anna, we need to get out of here now!
attributes.name: Rosalind

attributes.content: But... where can we go?
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: After that, we took refuge in the part of the city that wasn't overgrown with Originium, hiding from other survivors, hiding from Reunion.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: In the end, a Rhodes Island squad rescued us, and took us back to their base.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Who's there?!
attributes.name: Vanguard Operator

attributes.content: A kid?!
attributes.name: Vanguard Operator

attributes.content: She's armed!
attributes.name: Vanguard Operator

attributes.content: ...Kiss my ass.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Wait, we're here to rescue survivors!
attributes.name: Vanguard Operator

attributes.content: ...Huh?
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Calm down. We're with an organization called Rhodes Island. You're safe now.
attributes.name: Vanguard Operator

attributes.content: I survived. We survived.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: But I failed to do away with all Anna's worries. Honestly, I let her down.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Sonya, the students never would have become like this without the fire.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: It- it was an accident!
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: I don't blame you, Sonya. But if you had discussed it with me beforehand...
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: I just wanted you to be able to sleep at night.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Zima, I'm still willing to trust you.
attributes.name: Istina

attributes.content: But I don't know how to talk to you about these things.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: You're guilty.
attributes.name: Sonya?

attributes.content: I'm not.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: You deserve to die.
attributes.name: Gummy

attributes.content: It wasn't that bad.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: You let me go because you felt guilty.
attributes.name: Rosa

attributes.content: I didn't want to kill you.
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: Don't beat yourself up. You made a mistake is all.
attributes.name: Rosalind

attributes.content: I can't stop thinking about it!
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: I hate you.
attributes.name: Anna

attributes.content: Waaaaahhhh!
attributes.name: Sonya

attributes.content: ...aaaaaaaaaaaahhh!
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: *Puke*...
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: *Puke*...!
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: That dream again.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Anna, I...
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: The brown-haired girl slumps up against the washstand and stares out the window. The moon looks lovely this evening.
